thread.title: This landmark Paignton property has been sold at auction - Devon Live

author: Tina Penberthy-Hutchings
title: This landmark Paignton property has been sold at auction - Devon Live
text:
This landmark Paignton property has been sold at auction It included a former nightclub, three retail units and a managers' flat Share There was aggressive bidding for this South Devon property Get Daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Confident buyers paid 34 per cent over the guide price for a landmark site directly opposite Paignton train station at a recent auction.
Charles Darrow Network Auctions insists its latest auction results in London served as a positive indicator of the state of the current property market.
No.62-70 Victoria Street, comprising three ground floor retail units with a total area circa 3,000 square foot, former nightclub and associated areas circa 8,000 square foot with managers’ flat, along with a yard and cottage to the rear, clearly appealed to buyers on the day.
The development potential and robust guide price encouraged an aggressive range of bidding which took the sale price to £335,000 - £85,000 above its quoted guide price. Read More
Charles Darrow Network Auctions associate director James Sanders said the latest auction offers further proof of demand for buying properties at auction. Forde Park Nursing Home in Newton Abbot sold before the auction
He said: “It was an interesting catalogue with many of the lots being sold prior to the auction - which sees a property being sold before the auction but under auction conditions.
“It demonstrates that there is confidence when buying via a reputable auction house with local roots, even with the effects of Brexit uncertainty in the headlines, the market is still very much there for good opportunities. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
“I am delighted that this landmark building has sold after an aggressive marketing campaign. I’m sure the whole town will be interested to see what the planners have in store for this large, town centre site.”
Charles Darrow Network Auctions’ recent auction, held at the Grosvenor House Hotel in Mayfair, London, saw two further Devon properties being sold prior to the auction, for figures well in excess of the guide price. Le Chalet in Barnstaple sold for an undisclosed amount
The former Forde Park Nursing Home in Newton Abbot, which has planning permission for residential conversation, sold prior to the auction for a sum of £700,000, while Le Chalet in Barnstaple sold prior to the auction for an undisclosed amount. Read More
